newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan stocks end down on profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan stocks end down on profit-taking.

text.p: Pakistani stocks ended down on Tuesday as profit-taking towards the close wiped out early gains of blue chips on settlement day, dealers said.

"The index rose sharply in early trade on buying of blue chips, but heavy profit-taking towards the close dragged down the index," dealer Sajjad Mankani said. "But overall sentiment is positive and the index will rise on Wednesday."

The index fell 2.32 points, or 0.11 percent, to end at 2,023.09 from 2,055.41 points at midday. Gainers beat losers 154 to 83. Hub Power rose 0.75 rupees to 58.85. ICI Pakistan fell 0.40 rupees to 33.50. -- Amir Zia 9221-5685192
